fields.description:
In upgrade testing from 4.0.2 to 4.1.1 I have found a few problems.

# -Post upgrade EBS instance that was stopped pre-upgrade will not start after upgrade- this was a step from another upgrade and not part of this scenario
# Post upgrade running EBS instances will eventually go to stopped (I had a few running during upgrade. After the weekend all were stopped and hit issue #1)
# Post upgrade reporting does not report EBS instances although instance store instances that were running prior to upgrade and continue to run are reported.
# After leaving the cloud alone over the weekend, Monday morning unable to generate isntance report at all. (see attached log)
# Post upgrade volume report does not report volumes from before upgrade
# euca-describe volumes shows all volumes
# euca-describe-instances shows all instances

Topology
\[CLC CC\]
\[SC\]
\[WALRUS UFS\]
\[NC\]
fields.summary: Post upgrade EBS issues - running EBS instance won't start after upgrade due to invalid connection string

comments.body: [~kedwards][~tony] I'll wait until [~swathi]'s done with the investigation.

There was an issue with ebs instances failing to launch when they incorrectly referenced a kernel (perhaps related to EUCA-3854)

On upgrade to 4.1 it is expected that existing reporting data is deleted.

[~spark], the CLC logs seem to be filled with exceptions/errors around database operations and closed proxool connections. I don't see any errors on the Storage Controller as such. Since the lookup of instance metadata occurs before any further processing, the failing database operations may have caused the EBS operations to error out even before the SC came into picture
[~tony] What's the procedure to reproduce the issue?

[~spark],

To reproduce:
# deploy 4.0.2 cloud (I had a distributed topology with CLC, walrus, and SC all on separate hosts. The topology is in the description)
# Prior to upgrade as a non-euca account launch a couple EBS backed instances
# optional: I also had created an autoscaling group with desired capacity 2 with a launch config based on an instance store image
# Stop one of the instances so you have at least 1 running and 1 stopped
# Upgrade all components to latest  4.1.1 packages
# After upgrade the stopped instance was unable to start. Furthermore, after leaving the setup idle over the weekend I found that the running ebs instances had stopped at some point during that time. Those too are unable to start again.
# Instance store instances were not impacted.

I tried to reproduce the problem, but could not. I could successfully restart stopped instances after upgrade (4.0.2 -> 4.1.1). 

One thing I notice from the original setup is that iscsi attach fails on the NC (see the log below). This manifests only with the instances in the STOPPED state prior to the upgrade. I could RUN the new instance from the same image without a problem. I could stop and restart the instances post the upgrade. [~swathi] [~wwannemacher] I think the exception logs is not related to this. Do you have an idea on what the log means on the NC? 

2015-04-21 11:04:00 DEBUG 000022888 connect_iscsi_target     | connect script returned: 1, stdout: '', stderr: 'Target paths are not complete:/,vol-f538ef0e,vda,euca-bdm-ebs1-dev-vda,virtio,eucalyptus,/etc/ceph/ceph.client.eucalyptus.keyring,/etc/ceph/ceph.conf,,,,,,10.111.1.179,iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.one:store5
'
2015-04-21 11:04:00 ERROR 000022888 connect_ebs_volume       | Failed to connect to EBS target: ,,,,,10.111.1.179,iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.one:store5
I am not sure what the reporting issue was with the original setup. I did not see any problem with reporting after upgrade.
Still debugging, but the root issue is that SC's exportVolume has malformed connectionString returned for the volumes that's created prior to the upgrade.

The root issue is that prior to the upgrade, the export record's connection string has different format than the format after the upgrade. When the SC receives exportVolume call from NC, it finds that there's already existing export record for the volume and send the old string to NC. The NC can't process the string because it's in the old format. See the different string (iscsi,tgt in the beginning) in the records.

eucalyptus_shared=# select volume, connection_string from eucalyptus_storage.volume_exports;

 8aef81334cc95542014cc986095e0037 | ,,,n1bpviB60VQB9w/3Rb2lE1wJBwcm629CBxPsN8StLKk1Z715Hk6JWfdbXFAwcMjKxlOwmpC+lvzHS/wbTXomrZe5t+ZUK3q/SGM3KhUohUcJ9lPF+B
QIKtZZVz50HtbQXcwem1iXrA7DBIIAD1kSUgYCDszxrtKXShQkehYkvwVK7bq5VMSA6dGqYR7uRZ4/jcTcvUS3mNNeph0YD3c1tqVUg4Dn1edhwev/0euYSIt2UDa05B5NJeMpj2JHUuyRj38IiIrGiUa
/ByES+0FZxzvMKKaPGwZaSCVfUkmeBxpGZr2ic0Wd2jxJX+CZTVX2ObuSlId3S2JKdeZPAamWpw==,,10.111.1.179,iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.one:store5
 8aef81334cc9b37a014cdd248d790006 | iscsi,tgt,,,,c4/UkNJbK/iypsXbXf6SXqsc/gT9BK/TUhaf19h/hLxYnu3iWuThgixiwluj3jCqyXYATyNmmqKAsJqhrE/o7WeuUlQBrWj0EwO0pLbF
ZPX7ycLmLnnCoan3CmZj7qckn1RQ9N0jDj/NyGSEHqU2+2Nhr3F6qG+86e/COqVjnbGDs3HBudCKIrD6pufRk2l4rBfxrapFOvpgzZIg9d+Ahllq6zRQdE3oIm2hJo/DOdokgqUaKGJsJtJZqsRcjl4eN
wJ5gGk/xkOpukfyXuaR7vIHkhE4z2QTdyf9uus/EShxMA9ihiuX/gT2Nu3vglOVtwiar6B41XVFvPSvPjec5Q==,,10.111.1.179,iqn.2009-06.com.eucalyptus.one:store6

This looks like a bug.
[~wwannemacher] [~zhill] [~kedwards] ping

[~spark], stopping the instance prior to the upgrade will make NC send an UnexportVolume request to SC. The UnexportVolume logic will invalidate the export record causing any future ExportVolume request from NC to generate a new export record. I think the validity of this was tested in 4.0.2 -> 4.1.0 upgrade since the connection string format was modified in 4.1.0 code. We might have a bug if this is not happening. Was the EBS backed instance stopped prior to the upgrade?  Can you forward me the details to your upgrade setup and the instance id with this issue.

[~swathi] Yes that was what's happening when I tried to reproduce. Maybe it's safer to put extra code to make sure the connection string is valid in case UnexportVolume is lost before upgrade. The only setup that shows this problem is Tony's original setup. You can find the non-eucalyptus instances in the stopped state.

[~spark], [~tony], from the NC logs it looks like the EBS backed instance, i-002cd888, was not stopped prior to the upgrade. In addition, the NC logs contain errors when trying to adopt the instance post upgrade. The instance is ignored by NC which may have caused the CLC to mark it in stopped state. 

{noformat}
2015-04-17 16:23:38 ERROR 000022038 read_instance_xml        | failed to read /instance/rootDirective from /var/lib/eucalyptus/instances/work/AIDZZAJQMPJPZ3LOAPL4G/i-002cd888/instance.xml
2015-04-17 16:23:38 ERROR 000022038 load_instance_struct     | failed to read instance XML
2015-04-17 16:23:38  WARN 000022038 adopt_instances          | failed to recover Eucalyptus metadata of running domain i-002cd888, ignoring it
{noformat} 

At this point, the volumes are still exported on the SC since the instance was not stopped. Hence the existing export record is used on the subsequent ExportVolume request from NC. As [~spark] noted, the format of the connection string in the export record is outdated. This is definitely a bug but it may not be a blocker for upgrade in my opinion. My understanding is that all EBS instances should be stopped and instance store instances should be terminated prior to the upgrade. This is necessary as the NC's instance processing logic may have changed and there is a risk of loosing instances as it happened in the above case. [~tony], correct me if I'm wrong on that. Can you please try stoping the instance prior to the upgrade, run the upgrade and then start the instance?

I would recommend testing the above use case first before trying to introduce a code change at this point. I think this is definitely a bug that should be addressed in the next immediate release if not for 4.1.1

[~swathi], I think this is a blocker. Warm upgrade has always (at least since 3.2 I believe) been supported. It is expected running instances remain running. Also, if an EBS instance is stopped it is able to start after the upgrade. And running EBS instances can stop and restart after upgrade.

Got it [~tony]. I think the most simple way of fixing this issue is add some upgrade logic that verifies and corrects the connection string at upgrade time. I'll get on it. FYI, in the current state of the system, I don't think running EBS instances would continue to run after the upgrade even after this issue is fixed. The logs in my above comment show that NC may not be adopting running EBS instances correctly post upgrade. This is an entirely different bug, I'll open a new ticket and link it to this one.

Talked with [~dmitrii] about this and it looks like the /instance/rootDirective element was added recently and should be optional. A test to see if we can fix the instance is to make it an optional element. I've got a branch and will make the fix asap. [~tony], do you have a setup where you can reproduce this quickly? I can drop a new library on that host so we can retest fast if that's easiest.
[~zhill] the original setup from this bug is up. It is not a source build though. What do you need to test the fix pre-upgraded or post? I can get whatever you need. #pusherman
[~tony], let's continue on euca-10763, that's the ticket for the NC instance adoption issue.

Fixed the connection string format issue specifically. Upgrade to 4.1.1 should verify the format of the connection string in the database and modify (add prefix) to match the new format. 

[~tony] although this issue might be fixed, there is a possibility that the EBS instances running prior to the upgrade wont stop/start correctly after the upgrade. The reason behind it is that post upgrade NC may not be correctly accounting for volumes of EBS instances that were running prior to the upgrade. If that seems to be the case, we can open a different ticket and work on that issue separately

This issue is verified.

Upgraded 4.0.2 to 4.1.1 with stopped instance and instance was able to start after upgrade.

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.1.1
Release     : 0.0.23201.85.20150422git247db2b.el6

Instance stopped prior to upgrade can be started after. The format of the connection string in the DB is updated.

Before upgrade, notice the leading ',,,' in the connection_string column
{code}
eucalyptus_shared=# select * from volume_exports;
                id                |   creation_timestamp    |  last_update_timestamp  |          metadata_perm_uuid          | version |                                                                        
                                                                                                                       connection_string                                                                        
                                                                                                                        |   host_ip    |              host_iqn               | is_active |              token   
            |              volume

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+--------------+-------------------------------------+-----------+----------------------
------------+----------------------------------

ePxzxObL41E9qokysOIaw/7DWUchpBM45HIqdcKIogTrlxA+WdG7nuWLqDb5TYg4mfst6mA7rtqHqCu/kONjsjtnNe/Bsssfv4zumJseeufYKQc/LLHe9vYC3skqeEbCmrinhfDEcA8BrMNn0cMudwI/pUFTXXzxc7BhvFeq17HvhKm4Th0exrKNK4tZmqRvHvD+3Bqx2YJP8ZLi

2bd21cf02fb | 8aef85cd4ce21dff014ce2bb455602f7

After upgrade, notice the 'iscsi,tgt,' prefix appended to the connection_string
{code}

                id                |   creation_timestamp    |  last_update_timestamp  |          metadata_perm_uuid          | version |                                                                        
                                                                                                                            connection_string                                                                   
                                                                                                                                  |   host_ip    |              host_iqn               | is_active |            
  token               |              volume              
----------------------------------+-------------------------+-------------------------+--------------------------------------+---------+------------------------------------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 8aef85cd4ce21dff014ce2bd241902fd | 2015-04-22 13:06:28.633 | 2015-04-22 13:06:28.633 | c2f7626c-5b58-4593-a361-e7334bd02e90 |       0 | iscsi,tgt,,,,QfBsTJKm8af9lWPyCwnvkBXzp2qejH9xXcjY6AsQYKFBOU5wWTwGy7ECoC
CYIF/YKF8fePxzxObL41E9qokysOIaw/7DWUchpBM45HIqdcKIogTrlxA+WdG7nuWLqDb5TYg4mfst6mA7rtqHqCu/kONjsjtnNe/Bsssfv4zumJseeufYKQc/LLHe9vYC3skqeEbCmrinhfDEcA8BrMNn0cMudwI/pUFTXXzxc7BhvFeq17HvhKm4Th0exrKNK4tZmqRvHvD+3B

21dff014ce2bd21cf02fb | 8aef85cd4ce21dff014ce2bb455602f7
(1 row)

Fix Verified per my last comment.
Linked issue on NC adoption not treating BDM EBS volumes properly.
